perturbation.explanation: The change from 'Remarketing Settlement Date' to 'Remarketing Date' in Section 11 introduces an in-text contradiction related to the termination conditions. Now, the Remarketing Agents can terminate the agreement based on the conditions in Section 5 failing before noon on the Remarketing Date. This contradicts the intention of Section 5, which originally allowed assessment of conditions up to the Remarketing Settlement Date. The in-text contradiction arises because Section 5 is designed to ensure obligations and representations are in good order till the Remarketing Settlement Date, but Section 11 now allows for an earlier termination date. This in-text contradiction could lead to disputes over whether the Remarketing Agents acted appropriately in terminating the agreement, especially if a condition failed shortly before the Remarketing Settlement Date but after the Remarketing Date.
